meanings.definition: To pass or move along a route or path.
meanings.sent1: The car will traject through the winding road.
meanings.sent2: She trajects through the forest to reach her destination.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel trajects across the branches in search of nuts.
meanings.sent4: Time trajects swiftly, never pausing for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The river trajects gracefully through the valley, carving its path.

meanings.definition: The path or route taken by something moving from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The traject of the train passes through many towns.
meanings.sent2: She followed the traject marked on the map.
meanings.sent3: The traject of the ants led straight to the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: His life's traject took him from a small town to the big city.
meanings.sent5: The traject of the shooting star lit up the night sky briefly.
